title: 1D motion - derive velocity from position function

content.question: A cart’s position as a function of time is <math alttext="x equals, 10 times t raised to the three halves power, plus t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mpadded><mn>3</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mpadded></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi></math>, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is in centimeters and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is time in seconds. What is the cart’s velocity at <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="21 centimeters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>21</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="31 centimeters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>31</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="84 centimeters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>84</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="136 centimeters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>136</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="31 centimeters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>31</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
